scenarioDescription:
The EPIC 201841433 Exoplanetary System


Overview

EPIC 201841433 is a star with 0.8 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.63 times its radius. It is located 1423.63 light years away from the solar system.

EPIC 201841433 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the EPIC 201841433 system


EPIC 201841433 b

EPIC 201841433 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2019-07, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of EPIC 201841433 b is 1.119 times the mass of Earth. The radius of EPIC 201841433 b is 1.040 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, EPIC 201841433 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system EPIC 201841433, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: EPIC 201841433 - System With 1 Exoplanet
